Operation 'get_/content/{aspectId}' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. data.current_summary: Describes the documents and directories available within a specific 'aspect' (content group) of the BCLaws library
data.summary_suggestion: List documents and directories in a legislation aspect
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a hierarchical listing of all documents and directories available within a specified aspect (content group) of the BCLaws legislative library. Returns metadata including document identifiers, titles, and directory structure. Use this operation to browse available legislation or obtain the identifiers needed for document retrieval via the /document API.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too wordy and uses unclear terminology ('aspect' needs context). Description is completely missing, making it impossible for AI agents to understand what data is returned or how to use the operation. Added clarity about hierarchical structure, return values, and relationship to other APIs.

data.current_summary: Lists the metadata available for the specified index or directory from the BCLaws legislative respository
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve metadata for a specific legislation document or directory
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed metadata for a specified document or directory within an aspect of the BCLaws legislative repository. Returns information including the document identifier, index identifier, title, and nested content structure. Use this operation to explore legislation hierarchy or obtain the index and document identifiers required for document retrieval via the /document API.
data.reasoning: Summary uses vague terminology ('index or directory') without explaining what these represent. Description is missing entirely. Added clarity about what metadata is returned and how this operation relates to document retrieval workflows.

message: Operation 'get_/document/id/{aspectId}/{civixIndexId}/{civixDocumentId}/search/{searchString}' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary is adequate, but description lacks details about the search parameter and how highlighting is applied. Added clarity about search string usage and the highlighting behavior to help AI agents understand when to use this variant versus the non-search version.

data.current_summary: Retrieves a specific document from the BCLaws legislative repository with search text highlighted (HTML format)
data.current_description: The /document API allows you to retrieve actual documents from the BCLaws legislative repository. To retrieve a document from the repository you need the aspect identifier and two other specific pieces of information about the document: the index identifier and the document identifier. These unique identifiers can be retrieved from the /content API.
data.description_suggestion: The /document API allows you to retrieve actual documents from the BCLaws legislative repository with search terms highlighted in the output. To retrieve a document you need the aspect identifier, index identifier, and document identifier (obtainable from the /content API), plus a search string. The operation returns the document in HTML format with matching search terms visually highlighted. Use this to retrieve legislation while emphasizing relevant search results.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks details about the search parameter and how highlighting is applied. Added clarity about search string usage and the highlighting behavior to help AI agents understand when to use this variant versus the non-search version.

data.description_suggestion: The /document API allows you to retrieve actual documents from the BCLaws legislative repository with search terms highlighted in the output.
